Subjects: dialogues; Nature; envoys; lovers, addresses to beloved
_description: An epistle to his mistress, including a Dialogue between the Lover and Dame Nature—32 stanzas rhyme royal plus Envoy of 1 stanza rhyme royal

CamTCC599.First Lines:
[o] Lady myne to whom thys boke I sende I yow beseche with hert
                    humiliate Thorough instyence yef I ought offende And may nat please
                    your eares delicate…
CamTCC599.Last Lines:
…Of my lyfe or deth I can nomore say What [her] shall please
                    me must nede obey
